result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary W Kerbel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to use or possess of another person's identifying documents.
No contact with co-defendant without prior approval from Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours, standard release - STAYED and to be usedat Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Dated 04/27/16, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting clarification of sentence.
Dated 04/26/16, from Atty Kay, requesting correction to JOC.

Defendant Zachary W Kerbel in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's mother makes a statement. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kay makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements.  Court sentences the defendant to the following.

COUNT#2:

WITHHELD SENTENCE :   

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____no use or possesion of another person's identifying documents 
____No contact with:co defendant without prior approval from Probation Agent.
____Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Sheriff Department within (3) business days to provide DNA sample.

RESTITUTION:  already paid in full. 

COSTS:  $273.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 30 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED for use of agent with court permission.
Sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 03:00 pm
filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zachary W Kerbel in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a NOT GUILTY plea to Count #1 on information filed on January 28, 2016.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #2 on amended information filed today.  Court performs plea colloquy with Defendant and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2 on amended information.  Court sets sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Copy of letter and check to the State regarding restitution payment filed by Attorney Kay.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Preliminary hearing at 01-21-2016 08:15 am
Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Zachary W Kerbel in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kay requests a modification of bail conditions.  State objects to a modification of bail conditions.    The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Preliminary hearing date remains as set.

Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant/victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.  Defendant to provide new address to court by the next business day.
